text:
Kim Cattrall is not mincing words when it comes to Sarah Jessica Parker.

Cattrall lashed out Saturday at her former Sex and the City co-star after Parker expressed her condolences over the death of Cattrall's brother, Chris.

"Your continuous reaching out is a painful reminder of how cruel you really were then and now," Cattrall wrote on Instagram. "Let me make this VERY clear. (If I haven't already) You are not my family. You are not my friend. So I'm writing to tell you one last time to stop exploiting our tragedy in order to restore your 'nice girl' persona."

Cattrall finished the caption off with a link to a 2017 New York Post article about Sex and the City's "mean-girl culture."

"Copy and paste link," Cattrall concluded.

The two actresses reportedly have not gotten along for years.

During an interview with Piers Morgan in October, Cattrall said she had "never been friends" with her SATC co-stars, including Parker, and that she would not be part of the teased third film.

During an appearance on Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen Jan. 31, Parker opened up about her co-star Kim Cattrall's comments about their relationship, saying she didn't feel the same.

More:Kim Cattrall: 'Sex and the City' schedule kept me from having children

Cattrall's brother was found dead last week. He was 55.

Contributing: The Associated Press
